# Child Care Provider Training Requirements (2026)

## Training by Provider Type

### Licensed Center Staff

**Directors:**
- 12 postsecondary units in ECE/CD
- 3 units in administration
- 4+ years of experience

**Teachers:**
- 12 units ECE/CD including core courses
- 6 months classroom experience

**Assistant Teachers:**
- 6 units ECE/CD or
- Currently enrolled in ECE program

**Aides:**
- No educational requirements
- On-the-job training

### Licensed Family Child Care

**Required Before License:**
- 16 hours Health & Safety training:
  - Pediatric CPR
  - Pediatric First Aid
  - Preventive health practices
  - Nutrition
  - Safe sleep practices

**Ongoing:**
- Annual training hours (varies)
- CPR/First Aid renewal

### License-Exempt Providers

**For Subsidized Care:**
- Health and Safety orientation (offered by APP)
- No formal education required
- TrustLine background check (if not close relative)

## Specific Training Topics

### Health and Safety (All Providers)
- Pediatric CPR certification
- Pediatric First Aid certification
- Emergency preparedness
- Injury prevention
- Recognizing child abuse
- Nutrition and food safety

### California Early Childhood Educator Competencies
1. Child development and learning
2. Culture, diversity, and equity
3. Relationships, interactions, and guidance
4. Family and community engagement
5. Dual language development
6. Observation, screening, assessment, and documentation
7. Special needs and inclusion
8. Learning environments and curriculum
9. Health, safety, and nutrition
10. Leadership and professional development
11. Administration and supervision

## Where to Get Training

### Free/Low-Cost Options
- Local Resource & Referral agencies
- Community colleges (ECE programs)
- California Early Childhood Online (CECO)
- Head Start training programs

### Online Training
- **CECO:** https://www.ceco.net
- Professional development courses
- CPR/First Aid (in-person component required)

### Community Colleges
- Child Development/Early Childhood Education programs
- Available at all CA community colleges
- Financial aid available

## Child Development Permit (Teachers in State Programs)

For Title 5 programs (CSPP, Head Start), teachers need:

| Permit Level | Units Required | Experience |
|--------------|----------------|------------|
| Assistant | 6 ECE units | None |
| Associate | 12 ECE units | 50 days |
| Teacher | 24 ECE units | 175 days |
| Master Teacher | 24 ECE units + 16 GE | 350 days |
| Site Supervisor | 60+ units | 350 days + admin |
| Program Director | BA degree | 1 year admin |

## Training Assistance

**AB 212 Stipends:** Financial support for continuing education
**QRIS Block Grants:** Training funds through Quality Rating programs
**Workforce Pathway Programs:** Support for degree completion

**Find Training:** Contact your local R&R at rrnetwork.org
